text: Antidesma alexiteria is a species of plant in the family Phyllanthaceae. It was early classified as a genus within family Euphorbiaceae, but later moved into family Phyllanthaceae. It is endemic to Southern India and Sri Lanka. It is a small understory shrub with maximum height of 8m. Fruits are red in color. In Sri Lanka, the plant is known as "Heen embilla - හීන් ඇඹිල්‍ල", which is used in Ayurvedic purposes.http://www.instituteofayurveda.org/plants/plants_detail.php?i=478&s;=Family_name leaves of A. alexiteria are used as an antidote for many snake bites, and bark of the root for dysentery treatments.http://tropical.theferns.info/viewtropical.php?id=Antidesma+alexiteria ==References== * India Biodiversity alexiteria Category:Flora of India (region) Category:Flora of Sri Lanka Category:Taxa named by Carl Linnaeus Category:Plants described in 1753
